article.headline: North Florida 67, Savannah St. 57
article.story: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (AP) -- James Grimball scored 18 points and grabbed 15 rebounds to lead North Florida to a 67-57 win over Savannah State on Tuesday. Grimball had a double-double by halftime as he scored 12 points and grabbed 10 rebounds in the first 20 minutes. He made 7-of-9 field goal attempts and converted 4-of-6 shots at the foul line in 31 minutes of play. The Ospreys (2-22) held a 12-point lead with less than two minutes remaining but had to survive a late Tigers rally which cut the margin to seven with 40 seconds to play. Three North Florida players then sank a pair of free throws each to put the game out of reach and secure North Florida's first win in 88 days. Savannah State (11-17) held a 27-26 lead at halftime. The Tigers stretched it to three points early in the second half, but North Florida took the lead at the 13:25 mark on a layup by Tom Hammonds and never trailed after that. Their largest lead was 13 points at 55-42 with 4:22 remaining in the game. The Ospreys got a game-high 20 points from reserve Cortez Riley, 14 of which came in the second half. Savannah State was led by Joseph Flegler with 18 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
